description: Support for survivors of domestic abuse in Suffolk is seen as "fragmented and confused", a study finds.
title: Domestic abuse support in Suffolk 'fragmented'
title_page: Domestic abuse support in Suffolk 'fragmented' - BBC News
maintext:
Support for survivors of domestic abuse in Suffolk is seen as "fragmented and confused", a study produced for the county's police and crime commissioner (PCC) has found.
The study by University Campus Suffolk talked to 69 survivors of abuse, as well as 16 police officers and 24 professionals working with survivors.
It found "considerable gaps" in help provided, particularly in rural areas.
PCC Tim Passmore said the study was vital in understanding the problem.
